text: Far away from the Forest of Shadows, the defeated Zacharias plots his return to the Old World, aiming to destroy all that betrayed him before his demise.

Decades after his banishment from the Forests of Shadows, Zacharias the Everliving emerges in the faraway lands of Khuresh, a realm pulsating with undiscovered magical essence. Driven by a vengeful thirst, he seeks to harvest this potent power for his personal scheme — to enact revenge on those who expelled him and to return to the Old World as the harbinger of death. With every dark incantation, he draws upon the mystical currents of Khuresh, shaping the very fabric of magic to suit his malevolent desires. As the Everliving weaves his arcane plots, he becomes a shadowy force, a timeless revenant with an insatiable hunger for vengeance and a grand design to cast the Old World into darkness.
Far away from the Forest of Shadows, the defeated Zacharias plots his return to the Old World, aiming to destroy all that betrayed him before his demise.
Far away from the Forest of Shadows, the defeated Zacharias plots his return to the Old World, aiming to destroy all that betrayed him before his demise.
Far away from the High Realm of Atylwyth, the exiled warrior Sceolan plans his definitive return to the Oak Glades.

From the heart of Atylwyth, Sceolan the Hooked Blade, a mighty Wood Elf warrior and Ranger Lord, traversed the world roots to defend the exotic and mysterious kingdom nestled on the island of Tor Elithis. With his ethereal blade and unparalleled skill as a ranger, Sceolan stands as the guardian of the most enigmatic Wood Elven forest. As the whispers of the trees guide his path, he embraces the duty to protect the ancient secrets and natural wonders that thrive within the secluded realm. Sceolan, the embodiment of Wood Elf prowess, brings his unmatched ferocity and bowmanship to the faraway shores, ready to defend Tor Elithis from any who dare threaten its sanctity
Far away from the High Realm of Atylwyth, the exiled warrior Sceolan plans his definitive return to the Oak Glades.
Far away from the High Realm of Atylwyth, the exiled warrior Sceolan plans his definitive return to the Oak Glades.
Lavish as ever, Alphonse Dolmancé lands with his group of cultists in the far lands of Ind, ready to plunge into excess.

Born into nobility, Alphonsé Dolmance harbors a dark secret beneath the veneer of Bretonnian splendor. A clandestine servant and worshiper of Slaanesh, the god of excess, Dolmance's secret cult faced discovery. Fleeing the harsh judgment of Bretonnia, he sought refuge in the distant lands of Ind. Here, amidst the exotic landscapes, he and his cultists made landfall, ready to plunge the foreign lands into the throes of excess and indulgence. Alphonsé Dolmance, a noble with hidden desires, brings the seductive allure of Slaanesh to the mysterious and unsuspecting realms of Ind
Lavish as ever, Alphonse Dolmancé lands with his group of cultists in the far lands of Ind, ready to plunge into excess.
Lavish as ever, Alphonse Dolmancé lands with his group of cultists in the far lands of Ind, ready to plunge into excess.
Helbane sets out on his ultimate quest to destroy the Elven Colonies of Tor Elithis and claim all there is in the Witch King's name.

In the expanse of Naggaroth's shadow, Duriath Helbane, Malekith's formidable corsair, is bestowed a task most deemed insurmountable – the conquest of the enigmatic Island of Tor Elithis. Shrouded in mystery and distant beyond the reach of most Dark Elves, this land under High Elven rule is a challenge few would dare. Yet, Duriath, marked by the Witch King's trust, sets sail with determination etched in his soul. Armed with twin obsidian daggers and the weight of Malekith's expectations, he becomes the harbinger of Tor Elithis' doom. With the waves as witness, Duriath Helbane embarks on a journey into the unknown, dead set on proving himself, for failure is a fate he dare not entertain in the shadow of the Witch King's ambition.
Helbane sets out on his ultimate quest to destroy the Elven Colonies of Tor Elithis and claim all there is in the Witch King's name.
Helbane sets out on his ultimate quest to destroy the Elven Colonies of Tor Elithis and claim all there is in the Witch King's name.
The Keeper of the Iron Key sets out to perform the Witch King's bidding, forcing him to the far corners of the world in a plot unknown to him.
The Keeper of the Iron Key sets out to perform the Witch King's bidding, forcing him to the far corners of the world in a plot unknown to him.
The Keeper of the Iron Key sets out to perform the Witch King's bidding, forcing him to the far corners of the world in a plot unknown to him.
The Keeper of the Iron Key sets out to perform the Witch King's bidding, forcing him to the far corners of the world in a plot unknown to him.
The Master Engineer of the Engineer's Guild seeks new and undiscovered elements for his next fabrication, deep within the exotic jungles of Ind.

In the heart of dwarven realms, Burlok Damminsson stands as a paragon of stubborn determination and masterful engineering. Leading the Engineers Guild, he is renowned as the best engineer among dwarves. His blueprints, as valuable as the purest gold, tell tales of groundbreaking inventions that push the boundaries of dwarven craftsmanship. However, Burlok's insatiable drive leads him beyond the mountainous borders. He ventures into the jungles of Ind, at the helm of a guild expedition, seeking exotic tools and parts for his ultimate creation. With every step into the unknown, Burlok Damminsson strives to construct something unprecedented, a marvel that will etch his name into the annals of dwarven ingenuity
The Master Engineer of the Engineer's Guild seeks new and undiscovered elements for his next fabrication, deep within the exotic jungles of Ind.
The Master Engineer of the Engineer's Guild seeks new and undiscovered elements for his next fabrication, deep within the exotic jungles of Ind.
Deep within the steppes, Surtha Lenk, the High Zar of Tokmars, aims to unite the Kurgan tribes and rain chaos on the realms of men.

In the vast expanse of the Eastern Steppes, Surtha Lenk, a mighty Kurgan Warlord, leads the nomadic tribe of the Tokmars. Renowned for their exceptional hunting prowess, the Tokmars traverse the steppes under Surtha's command. Armed with a spear that skewers even the most horrific and enormous beasts, Lenk plots a grand and primal ambition — to hunt and capture all known beasts, unleashing their feral fury upon the unsuspecting lands of Cathay. With each nomadic step, Surtha Lenk's tribe becomes an unstoppable force, ready to bring untamed chaos to the heart of the Eastern realms.
Deep within the steppes, Surtha Lenk, the High Zar of Tokmars, aims to unite the Kurgan tribes and rain chaos on the realms of men.
Deep within the steppes, Surtha Lenk, the High Zar of Tokmars, aims to unite the Kurgan tribes and rain chaos on the realms of men.
Aspiring to be Nurgle's new gardener, Orghotts and his legendary Pox Rider march eagerly toward the earthfather's realm.

In the putrid embrace of decay, Orghotts Daemonspew, a mighty Chaos Champion, fervently seeks the favor of Nurgle, the god of rot and decay. His singular purpose is to enter Nurgle's garden, a grotesque paradise of decay, and serve as the Plaguefather's personal gardener. To achieve this unholy task, Orghotts must first defeat the current gardener, proving himself worthy of the coveted position. With each vile victory, he inches closer to the festering dream of cultivating the foul gardens of Nurgle, where life and death dance in a never-ending cycle of pestilence and rebirth.
Aspiring to be Nurgle's new gardener, Orghotts and his legendary Pox Rider march eagerly toward the earthfather's realm.
Aspiring to be Nurgle's new gardener, Orghotts and his legendary Pox Rider march eagerly toward the earthfather's realm.
Hrothyogg, the legendary Maneater, comfortably sits on his improvised throne, collecting the ultimate toll from anyone who passes his valley.

In the perilous lands roamed by the Ogres, Hrothyogg stands as a feared and revered Maneater, his reputation echoing in the growls and whispers of the wild. Leading the infamous Deathtoll tribe, he is a merciless executor of mercenary contracts, bringing down even the mightiest champions for the right price. Nestled within a steep valley, the Deathtoll camp becomes a fearsome tollgate for all who dare to pass. Hrothyogg, imposing and relentless, claims a toll in gold or meat from anyone crossing his path. His tribe, living up to its ominous name, enforces a deadly toll that leaves echoes of fear across the untamed lands.
Hrothyogg, the legendary Maneater, comfortably sits on his improvised throne, collecting the ultimate toll from anyone who passes his valley.
Hrothyogg, the legendary Maneater, comfortably sits on his improvised throne, collecting the ultimate toll from anyone who passes his valley.
Fueled by bloodlust, the Destroyer of Khorne remains undefeated, and as he strings together more victories and his power grows, so does his unbridled lust for more slaughter.

Arbaal, an indomitable force, stands as Khorne's chosen, the Undefeated. His campaign, a relentless pursuit of bloodshed and conquest, hinges on an unbroken momentum. As victories string together, the rewards grow ever more formidable, and Arbaal becomes an embodiment of Khorne's favor. However, within the crucible of battle, defeat is not an option. Khorne's wrath is unforgiving, and with each setback, Arbaal faces a relentless punishment, forced to start anew. A cycle of endless warfare ensues, an eternal struggle for supremacy where the Undefeated seeks to appease the Blood God's insatiable thirst for carnage. Will Arbaal rise above the trials, or be condemned to an eternity of unyielding strife? The fate of the Undefeated lies in the balance, a crimson tale etched in the annals of Khorne's glory.
Fueled by bloodlust, the Destroyer of Khorne remains undefeated, and as he strings together more victories and his power grows, so does his unbridled lust for more slaughter.
Fueled by bloodlust, the Destroyer of Khorne remains undefeated, and as he strings together more victories and his power grows, so does his unbridled lust for more slaughter.
Lord Karitamen emerges with his cultists that worship the Father of All on the distant shores of Nippon, partaking in some sinister plot involving the eternal Sun.

In the shadowy expanses of Nippon, the mighty Tomb King Karitamen, known as the Liche Lord, commands the Sons of Ptra—an unholy brotherhood devoted to the blasphemous worship of the Unholy Sun. Having emerged on the distant island to carry out a sinister plot entwined with the sun's malevolent influence, Karitamen finds himself in a fateful clash with the native inhabitants of Nippon. These locals, who revere the sun from their own pantheon, stand toe-to-toe with the undying ruler, creating a dark and foreboding clash of ancient powers that echoes across the mystical landscape of Nippon.
Lord Karitamen emerges with his cultists that worship the Father of All on the distant shores of Nippon, partaking in some sinister plot involving the eternal Sun.
Lord Karitamen emerges with his cultists that worship the Father of All on the distant shores of Nippon, partaking in some sinister plot involving the eternal Sun.
The Champion of Bastion Stair once more roams the mortal realm, seeking his next worthy challenger and inevitable victim.

In the twisted realm of unending slaughter, Bastion Stair stands as the ultimate trial for any aspiring champion of Khorne. An unending staircase, each step steeped in the blood of fallen challengers, presents an ever-escalating gauntlet of combat and carnage. It is within this infernal crucible that Lord Slaurith emerged as Khorne's unyielding champion. For countless years, he stood undefeated at the base of Bastion Stair, a relentless force facing each aspirant champion who descended in a macabre dance of crimson death. Slaurith, a living testament to the insatiable hunger of Khorne, now stands as the embodiment of unending strength and unbroken resolve within the accursed shadows of Bastion Stair.
The Champion of Bastion Stair once more roams the mortal realm, seeking his next worthy challenger and inevitable victim.
The Champion of Bastion Stair once more roams the mortal realm, seeking his next worthy challenger and inevitable victim.
For centuries, Torinubar has ruled over the Gates of Calith in the name of the Phoenix Kings of Ulthuan, and as such, he has become accustomed to managing the trade routes that pass through them.

In the realm where the mystical meets the mundane, High Mage Torinubar reigns supreme as the Arch Mage of the Gates of Calith. His dominion over the sea strait, connecting the unknown realms of the East with the known world, has transformed the Gates into a bustling hub of exotic trade. A master of both the arcane and commerce, Torinubar's ability to weave magic is matched only by his skill in navigating the intricate web of trade routes. Under his wise rule, the Gates of Calith have become a beacon of prosperity, where the currents of magic and commerce intertwine in a harmonious dance that echoes across the seas.
For centuries, Torinubar has ruled over the Gates of Calith in the name of the Phoenix Kings of Ulthuan, and as such, he has become accustomed to managing the trade routes that pass through them.
For centuries, Torinubar has ruled over the Gates of Calith in the name of the Phoenix Kings of Ulthuan, and as such, he has become accustomed to managing the trade routes that pass through them.
On his quest for daemonic ascension, the Kurgan Zar, Thorgar the Blooded One, leads his warmongering Khazag tribe to eternal glory or inevitable demise.

Thorgar the Blooded One, fervent champion of Chaos, hungers for ultimate power. In the desolate lands where blood stains the snow, he forges a dark pact with the Chaos Gods. His every deed, every soul claimed in the name of the Ruinous Powers, propels him toward the coveted title of Daemon Prince. Thorgar's ambition echoes across the icy wastes, a symphony of chaos drawing him closer to the immortal realm of the unholy.
On his quest for daemonic ascension, the Kurgan Zar, Thorgar the Blooded One, leads his warmongering Khazag tribe to eternal glory or inevitable demise.
On his quest for daemonic ascension, the Kurgan Zar, Thorgar the Blooded One, leads his warmongering Khazag tribe to eternal glory or inevitable demise.
The Kurgan warlord of the Ravenblessed tribe, Volrik Clawhand, willingly partakes in the Architect of Fate's next plot.

In the desolate eastern steppes, Volrik Clawhand, a Norscan warlord of Khurgan descent, stands as a staunch and devoted servant of Tzeentch, the chaos god of change. Leading the Ravenblessed tribe, Volrik's mind is entwined with the whispers of ravens above, guiding his every move through the barren wastes. Unbeknownst to him, he plays a role in Tzeentch's grand scheme, a puppet of fate dancing to the whims of the Architect of Fate. His tribe follows willingly, their devotion translating into a formidable force that carves chaos across the steppes. Volrik Clawhand, a powerful champion of Tzeentch, blindly strides towards an unknown destiny, leaving behind a trail of change and uncertainty in the wake of his unknowing servitude.
The Kurgan warlord of the Ravenblessed tribe, Volrik Clawhand, willingly partakes in the Architect of Fate's next plot.
The Kurgan warlord of the Ravenblessed tribe, Volrik Clawhand, willingly partakes in the Architect of Fate's next plot.
The right hand of Asavar Kul now serves Archaon the Everchosen as his chief recruiter, aspiring to be the very catalyst of the End Times.

Engra Deathsword, a name whispered in dread across the accursed lands. This formidable Chaos Lord, adorned in twisted armor, is the chosen vessel for the malevolent entity known as Drach'nyen. A living weapon of Chaos, Engra strides through the battlefield with an unholy purpose. Driven by a thirst for souls, Deathsword carves a path of destruction, each swing of the fellblade an ode to the boundless power of the Ruinous Powers. Those who face him tremble not only at the might of a Chaos Lord but at the ever-present specter of Drach'nyen, a force that hungers for the downfall of reality itself.
The right hand of Asavar Kul now serves Archaon the Everchosen as his chief recruiter, aspiring to be the very catalyst of the End Times.
The right hand of Asavar Kul now serves Archaon the Everchosen as his chief recruiter, aspiring to be the very catalyst of the End Times.
Ravaging and razing in the name of the Blood God, Valbrand sailed his raiders eastward, craving more skulls to sacrifice in his patron's name.

In the tumultuous seas, Valbrand Fireblade, a colossal Norscan Warlord, commands his infamous Dragonfleet. A relentless slaver, he sails to the far reaches of the known world, seeking settlements to sack and capturing slaves for the highest bidder. Towering in size, he wields a broad blade longer than many a tree, a weapon fueled by the flames of conquest. Blessed by the demon Suthrond, Valbrand bears the power of never-ending fire, a force that ignites fear among both friend and foe. With every port plundered, he leaves a trail of destruction and the scent of smoldering embers in the wake of his insatiable quest for power and dominion.
Ravaging and razing in the name of the Blood God, Valbrand sailed his raiders eastward, craving more skulls to sacrifice in his patron's name.
Ravaging and razing in the name of the Blood God, Valbrand sailed his raiders eastward, craving more skulls to sacrifice in his patron's name.
